events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 28, involving minor damages to the front bumper and hood. No injuries were reported at the scene.
The claim was classified under 'Auto Accident' following a review of the incident details and vehicle damage description.
An agent with expertise in auto claims was assigned to the case to ensure a smooth and efficient handling process.
Acknowledgement notification sent to the customer confirming receipt of their auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
Request sent to customer asking for police report, photographs of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates for processing the claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report, detailed accident photos, and two mechanic repair quotes.
Investigation into the claim began involving review of submitted documentation and contacting relevant third parties for verification.
Investigation concluded confirming that the accident was caused by a third party’s negligence with no discrepancies found.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and a rental vehicle allowance during the repair period.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the prompt and fair offer.
Approval was granted to proceed with the payment for repair costs in accordance with the agreed settlement.
Payment was successfully issued to the customer’s nominated account covering all approved costs related to the vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that repairs were completed satisfactorily.
